original_title: In a day of mixed fortunes for bourse, Dialog proves biggest contributor to turnover
original_body_lines: The investor sentiment at the CSE yesterday reflected sensitivity to the latest developments on the economic front. Consequently, the market indicated a somewhat gloomy outlook, resulting in the market projecting mixed reactions, stock market analysts said.

The All Share Price Index went down by 5.02 points, while the S and P SL20 rose by 1.92 points. Turnover stood at Rs 1.49 billion with one crossing. The crossing was reported in Dialog, which crossed 7.7 million shares to the tune of Rs 85.8 million; its shares traded at Rs 11.10.

In the retail market, companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Dialog Rs 127.2 million (11.3 million shares traded), ACL Cables Rs 108.6 million (1.1 million shares traded), JKH Rs 79.6 million (404,000 shares traded), HNB Rs 66.2 million (308,000 shares traded), Kelani Cables Rs 64.5 million (195,000 shares traded), Commercial Bank Rs 54.8 million (505,000 shares traded) and Sampath Bank 47.5 million (577,000 shares traded). During the day 71.7 million share volumes changed hands in 15000 transactions.

It is said that Dialog was the biggest contributor to the turnover due to its crossing and retail trading activities. The manufacturing sector also contributed in a significant manner to the turnover, especially ACL Cables and JKH. The Banking sector was also very active in the market, especially HNB and Commercial Bank.

Further, the overall rate of inflation as measured by the National Consumer Price Index decreased to 0.22 percent in September 2024 compared to 1.1 percent in August. Food inflation decreased to 0.5 percent in the month of September compared to 2.3 percent in August
Yesterday the rupee opened slightly stronger at Rs 292.90/293.10 to the US dollar, from Rs 293.00/20 a day earlier, while bond yields were up, dealers said.

A bond maturing on 15.12.2027 was quoted at 11.30/40 percent, up from 11.25/45 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2028 was quoted at 11.70/75 percent. A bond maturing on 15.09.2029 was quoted at 11.90/12.10 percent, up from 11.90/12.05 percent.
